snippet: Monday was a big day for smartphones at the International Consumer Electronics Show. AT&T talked about new smartphones that would run on its fast 4G network, including the Titan II from HTC. And Nokia, as expected, unveiled the Lumia 900, running...
abstract: Monday was a big day for smartphones at the International Consumer Electronics Show. AT&T talked about new smartphones that would run on its fast 4G network, including the Titan II from HTC. And Nokia, as expected, unveiled the Lumia 900, running Windows Phone.
lead_paragraph: Monday was a big day for smartphones at the International Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. AT&T talked about new smartphones that would run on its fast 4G network, including the Titan II from HTC. And Nokia, as expected, unveiled the Lumia 900, Nick Wingfield reported from the show. That phone, which runs Microsoft's Windows Phone operating system, represents a bid by Microsoft and Nokia to return to relevance in the smartphone market, after being marginalized by Apple and Google's Android system.

headline.main: Daily Report: Nokia and Microsoft Unveil an Ambitious Phone
